HtmlTableTabulator Module¶

class epyk.core.html.tables.HtmlTableTabulator.BottomCalcParams(report, attrs=None, options=None)¶
property precision¶

the number of decimals to display (default is 2), setting this value to false will display however many decimals are provided with the number

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/column-calcs#func-builtin

class epyk.core.html.tables.HtmlTableTabulator.Column(report, attrs=None, options=None)¶
property align¶

sets the text alignment for this column (left|center|right)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property bottomCalc¶

the column calculation to be displayed at the bottom of this column(see Column Calculations for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property bottomCalcParams¶

additional parameters you can pass to the bottomCalc calculation function(see Column Calculations for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

Return type

BottomCalcParams

property cssClass¶

EnumColCss

Type

rtype

property editable¶

callback to check if the cell is editable (see Manipulating Data for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property editors¶

Tabulator comes with a number of built-in editors including:

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/edit#edit-builtin

property exts¶

Tabulator is built in a modular fashion with a core codebase providing basic table rendering functionality and a series of modules that provide all of its wonderfull features.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.0/modules

property field¶

Required (not required in icon/button columns) this is the key for this column in the data array

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property formatters¶

You can set cell formatters on a per column basis using the formatter option in the column definition object.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5

property frozen¶

freezes the column in place when scrolling (see Frozen Columns for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property headerSort¶

user can sort by clicking on the header (see Sorting Data for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property headerVertical¶

change the orientation of the column header to vertical (see Vertical Column Headers for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property headerVisible¶

By setting the headerVisible option to false you can hide the column headers and present the table as a simple list if needed.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property minwidth¶

sets the minimum width of this column, this should be set in pixels (this takes priority over the global option of columnMinWidth)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/columns

property resizable¶

set whether column can be resized by user dragging its edges (see Table Layout for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property responsive¶

an integer to determine when the column should be hidden in responsive mode (see Responsive Layout for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property sorter¶

By default Tabulator will attempt to guess which sorter should be applied to a column based on the data contained in the first row.

http://tabulator.info/examples/4.5#sorters

Return type

EnumSorter

property title¶

Required This is the title that will be displayed in the header for this column

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property titleFormatter¶

formatter function for header title (see Formatting Data for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property topCalc¶

the column calculation to be displayed at the top of this column(see Column Calculations for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property validator¶

set the validator to be used to approve data when a user edits a cell. (see Manipulating Data for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/validate

property width¶

sets the width of this column, this can be set in pixels or as a percentage of total table width (if not set the system will determine the best)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

property widthGrow¶

when using fitColumns layout mode, determines how much the column should grow to fill available space (see Table Layout for more details)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/columns

class epyk.core.html.tables.HtmlTableTabulator.ColumnsGroup(report, attrs=None, options=None)¶
class epyk.core.data.DataClass(report, attrs=None, options=None)¶
attr(name, value)¶

Add an attribute to the Javascript underlying dictionary

Parameters

  • name – String. The attribute name

  • value – Object. The attribute value

Returns

“Self” to allow the chains on the Python side

custom(name, value)¶

Custom function to add a bespoke attribute to a class.

This entry point will not be able to display any documentation but it is a shortcut to test new features. If the value is a Javascript object, the PyJs object must be used

Parameters

  • name – String. The key to be added to the attributes

  • value – String or JString. The value of the defined attributes

Returns

The DataAttrs to allow the chains

get(dflt=None, name=None)¶

Get tje attribute to the underlying attributes dictionary

Parameters

  • dflt – Optional. The default value of this attribute

  • name – Optional. The attribute name. default the name of the function

Returns

has_attribute(clsObj)¶

Add an extra sub layer to the data structure. The key in the object representation will be the function name

Parameters

clsObj – Class. The sub data class used in the structure definition

set(value, name=None)¶

Add an attribute to the Javascript underlying dictionary

Parameters

  • value – Object. The attribute value

  • name – Optional. The attribute name. default the name of the function

Returns

“Self” to allow the chains on the Python side

sub_data(name, clsObj)¶

Add an extra sub layer to the data structure. The key in the object representation will be the function name

Should use has_attribute is the name can be deduced from the parent function

Parameters

  • name – String. The key to be added to the internal data dictionary

  • clsObj – Object. The object which will be added to the nexted data structure

sub_data_enum(name, clsObj)¶
Parameters

  • name – String. The key to be added to the internal data dictionary

  • clsObj – Object. The object which will be added to the nexted data structure

class epyk.core.html.tables.HtmlTableTabulator.Editor(report, attrs, parent=None)¶
autocomplete(values, showListOnEmpty=None, freetext=None, allowEmpty=None, searchFunc=None, listItemFormatter=None, sortValuesList=None, defaultValue=None, elementAttributes=None, verticalNavigation=None, **kwargs)¶

The autocomplete editor allows users to search a list of predefined options passed into the values property of the editorParams option.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/edit#edit-builtin

Parameters

  • values – a list of values to be displayed to the user

  • showListOnEmpty – show all values in the list when the input element is empty (default false)

  • freetext – allow the user to press enter to save a value to the cell that is not in the list (default false)

  • allowEmpty – allow the user to save an empty value to the cell (default false)

  • searchFunc – unction to search through array of value objects and return those that match the search term

  • listItemFormatter – a function that should return the HTML contents for each item in the value list

  • sortValuesList – if values property is set to true this option can be used to set how the generated list should be sorted

  • defaultValue – set the value that should be selected by default if the cells value is undefined

  • elementAttributes – set attributes directly on the input element

  • verticalNavigation – determine how use of the up/down arrow keys will affect the editor,

input(search=True, elementAttributes=None, **kwargs)¶

The input editor allows entering of a single line of plain text

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/edit#edit-builtin

Parameters

  • search – use search type input element with clear button

  • elementAttributes – set attributes directly on the input element

number(min=None, max=None, step=1, elementAttributes=None, verticalNavigation='table', **kwargs)¶

The number editor allows for numeric entry with a number type input element with increment and decrement buttons.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/edit#edit-builtin

Parameters

  • min – the maximum allowed value

  • max – the minimum allowed value

  • step – the step size when incrementing/decrementingthe value (default 1)

  • elementAttributes – set attributes directly on the input element

  • verticalNavigation – determine how use of the up/down arrow keys will affect the editor,

  • kwargs –

range(min=None, max=None, step=1, elementAttributes=None, **kwargs)¶

The range editor allows for numeric entry with a range type input element.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/edit#edit-builtin

Parameters

  • min – the maximum allowed value

  • max – the minimum allowed value

  • step – the step size when incrementing/decrementingthe value (default 1)

  • elementAttributes – set attributes directly on the input element

  • kwargs –

select(values, listItemFormatter=None, sortValuesList=None, defaultValue=None, elementAttributes=None, verticalNavigation='hybrid', **kwargs)¶

The select editor creates a dropdown select box to allow the user to select from some predefined options passed into the values property of the editorParams option.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/edit#edit-builtin

Parameters

  • values – a list of values to be displayed to the user

  • listItemFormatter – a function that should return the HTML contents for each item in the value list

  • sortValuesList – if values property is set to true this option can be used to set how the generated list should be sorted

  • defaultValue – set the value that should be selected by default if the cells value is undefined

  • elementAttributes – set attributes directly on the input element

  • verticalNavigation – determine how use of the up/down arrow keys will affect the editor,

  • kwargs –

stars(elementAttributes=None, **kwargs)¶

The star editor allows entering of numeric value using a star rating indicator.

This editor will automatically detect the correct number of stars to use if it is used on the same column as the star formatter.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/edit#edit-builtin

Parameters

  • elementAttributes – set attributes directly on the star holder elemen

  • kwargs –

textarea(verticalNavigation='editor', elementAttributes=None, **kwargs)¶

The textarea editor allows entering of multiple lines of plain text

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/edit#edit-builtin

Parameters

  • verticalNavigation – set attributes directly on the textarea element

  • elementAttributes – determine how use of the up/down arrow keys will affect the editor,

tick(tristate=False, indeterminateValue=None, elementAttributes=None, **kwargs)¶

The tick editor allows for boolean values using a checkbox type input element.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/edit#edit-builtin

Parameters

  • tristate – allow tristate tickbox (default false)

  • indeterminateValue – when using tristate tickbox what value should the third indeterminate state have (default null)

  • elementAttributes – set attributes directly on the input element

  • kwargs –

class epyk.core.html.tables.HtmlTableTabulator.EnumLayout(report, value=None)¶
fitColumns()¶

As an alternative to the default data fit, you can use the fitColumns layout mode to cause Tabulator to resize columns so they fit perfectly in the available table width.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/layout

fitDataFill()¶

The fitDataFill layout mode functions in the same way as the fitData mode, but ensures that rows are always at least the full width of the table.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/layout

fitDataStretch()¶

The fitDataStretch layout mode functions in the same way as the fitDataFill mode, but instead of stretching the empty row to fill the table it stretches the last visible column.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/layout

class epyk.core.html.tables.HtmlTableTabulator.EnumSorter(report, value=None)¶
alphanum()¶

Sorts column as alpha numeric code

http://tabulator.info/examples/4.5#sorters

boolean()¶

Sorts column as booleans

http://tabulator.info/examples/4.5#sorters

date()¶

Sorts column as dates

http://tabulator.info/examples/4.5#sorters

number()¶

Sorts column as numbers (integer or float, will also handle numbers using “,” separators)

http://tabulator.info/examples/4.5#sorters

string()¶

Sorts column as strings of characters

http://tabulator.info/examples/4.5#sorters

time()¶

Sorts column as dates

sorts column as times

class epyk.core.html.tables.HtmlTableTabulator.Extensions(report, attrs, parent=None)¶
property editors¶

The edit module allows the user to change data in cells, header filters are also dependant on this module.

More information on these functions can be found in the Editing Data Documentation.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.0/modules

property formatters¶

You can set cell formatters on a per column basis using the formatter option in the column definition object.

You can pass an optional additional parameter with the formatter, formatterParams that should contain an object with additional information for configuring the formatter.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.0/format

property mutators¶

Mutators are used to alter data as it is parsed into Tabulator. For example if you wanted to convert a numeric column into a boolean based on its value, before the data is used to build the table.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.0/mutators

property validators¶

The validate module allows for validation of editied data before it is stored in the table. More information on these functions can be found in the Validation Documentation. This can be extended to add custom validator functions to the default list:

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.0/modules

class epyk.core.html.tables.HtmlTableTabulator.Formattors(report, attrs, parent=None)¶
color(**kwargs)¶

The color formater sets the background colour of the cell to the value. The cell’s value can be any valid CSS color eg. #ff0000, #f00, rgb(255,0,0), red, rgba(255,0,0,0), hsl(0, 100%, 50%)

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/format

custom(value)¶
Parameters

value –

datetime(inputFormat='YYYY-MM-DD', outputFormat='YYYY-MM-DD', invalidPlaceholder='(invalid date)', **kwargs)¶

The datetime formater transforms on format of date or time into another.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/format

Parameters

  • inputFormat –

  • outputFormat –

  • invalidPlaceholder –

  • kwargs –

html(**kwargs)¶

he html formater displays un-sanitized html.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/format

Parameters

kwargs –

image(height=None, width=None, **kwargs)¶

The image formater creates an img element with the src set as the value. (triggers the normalizeHeight function on the row on image load).

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/format

Parameters

  • height – a CSS value for the height of the image

  • width – a CSS value for the width of the image

  • kwargs –

link(label=None, url=None, target='_blank', urlPrefix=None, labelField=None, urlField=None, **kwargs)¶

The link formater renders data as an anchor with a link to the given value (by default the value will be used as both the url and the label of the tag).

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/format

Parameters

  • label – a string representing the lable, or a function which must return the string for the label, the function is passed the Cell Component as its first argument

  • url – a string representing the url, or a function which must return the string for the url, the function is passed the Cell Component as its first argument

  • target – a string representing the value of the anchor tags target artibute (eg. set to “_blank” to open link in new tab)

  • urlPrefix – a prefix to put before the url value (eg. to turn a emaill address into a clickable mailto link you should set this to “mailto:”)

  • labelField – the field in the row data that should be used for the link lable

  • urlField – the field in the row data that should be used for the link url

  • kwargs –

lookup(data, **kwargs)¶

The lookup formater looks up the value to display from a object passed into the formatterParams property, if not present it displays the current cell value

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/format

Parameters

data – Dictionary for the lookup

money(decimal=',', thousand='.', precision=False, symbol=None, symbolAfter=None, **kwargs)¶

The money formater formats a number into currency notation (eg. 1234567.8901 -> 1,234,567.89).

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/format

Parameters

  • decimal – Symbol to represent the decimal point (default “.”)

  • thousand – Symbol to represent the thousands seperator (default “,”)

  • precision – the number of decimals to display (default is 2), setting this value to false will display however many decimals are provided with the number

  • symbol – currency symbol (no default)

  • symbolAfter – position the symbol after the number (default false)

  • kwargs –

progress(min=0, max=100, color=None, legend=None, legendColor=None, legendAlign=None, **kwargs)¶
Parameters

  • min –

  • max –

  • color –

  • legend –

  • legendColor –

  • legendAlign –

  • kwargs –

star(starts, **kwargs)¶

The star formater displays a graphical star rating based on integer values.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/format

Parameters

starts – maximum number of stars to be displayed (default 5)

text(**kwargs)¶

The plaintext formater is the default formatter for all cells and will simply dispay the value of the cell as text.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/format

Parameters

kwargs –

textarea(**kwargs)¶

The textarea formater shows text with carriage returns intact (great for multiline text), this formatter will also adjust the height of rows to fit the cells contents when columns are resized.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/format

Parameters

kwargs –

tickcross(allowEmpty=True, allowTruthy=True, tickElement="<i class='fa fa-check'></i>", crossElement="<i class='fa fa-times'></i>", **kwargs)¶

The tickCross formatter displays a green tick if the value is (true|’true’|’True’|1) and a red cross if not.

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.1/format

Parameters

  • allowEmpty – set to true to cause empty values (undefined, null, “”) to display an empty cell instead of a cross (default false)

  • allowTruthy – set to true to allow any truthy value to show a tick (default false)

  • tickElement – custom HTML for the tick element, if set to false the tick element will not be shown (it will only show crosses)

  • crossElement – custom HTML for the cross element, if set to false the cross element will not be shown (it will only show ticks)

  • kwargs –

wrapper("progress", {"height": '6px'}, {'color': ['orange', 'green']})¶
Parameters

  • formatter –

  • css_attrs –

  • formatterParams –

class epyk.core.html.tables.HtmlTableTabulator.Persistence(report, attrs=None, options=None)¶
property columns¶

You can ensure the layout of columns is stored for the next page load by setting the columns property of the persistence option to true

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/release#persistence

property filter¶

You can ensure the data filtering is stored for the next page load by setting the filter property of the persistence option to true

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/release#persistence

property group¶

You can ensure the row grouping settings are stored for the next page load by setting the group property of the persistence option to true

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/release#persistence

Return type

PersistenceGroup

property page¶

You can ensure the pagination settings are stored for the next page load by setting the page property of the persistence option to true

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/release#persistence

Return type

PersistencePage

property sort¶

You can ensure the data sorting is stored for the next page load by setting the sort property of the persistence option to true

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/release#persistence

property autoColumns¶

If you set the autoColumns option to true, every time data is loaded into the table through the data option or through the setData function, Tabulator will examine the first row of the data and build columns to match that data.

class epyk.core.html.tables.HtmlTableTabulator.TableTreeConfig(report, attrs=None, options=None)¶
class epyk.core.html.tables.HtmlTableTabulator.Validators(report, attrs, parent=None)¶
float()¶

The float validator allows values that are valid floats

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/validate

integer()¶

The integer validator allows values that are valid integers

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/validate

list(vals)¶

The in validator allows that values that match a value from the | delimieted string in the parameter

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/validate

max(val)¶

The max validator allows numeric values that are less than or equal to parameter

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/validate

maxLength(val)¶

The maxLength validator allows string values that have a length less than or equal to parameter

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/validate

min(val)¶

The min validator allows numeric values that are greater than or equal to parameter

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/validate

numeric()¶

The float validator allows values that are valid floats

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/validate

regex(val)¶

The regex validator allows values that match the supplied regex

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/validate

required()¶

The required validator allows values that are not null or an empty string

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/validate

unique()¶

The unique validator allows values that do not match the value of any other cell in this column

http://tabulator.info/docs/4.5/validate
